intro: Dodecatheon hendersonii var. gracile, commonly known as the Henderson's globemallow, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, characterized by its showy, five-petaled flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in rocky soils and arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while the stems are often reddish in color. The species is noted for its unique floral structure and is of interest to botanists and horticulturists alike.
